title: How to Make Atholl Brose

steps.headline: Soak the oats in water for 24 hours.
steps.description: Place 1/2 cup (65 g) of steel-cut oats in a bowl. Then, cover the oats in about 1 ⁄2 cups (350 mL) of water. Set the oats and water in a safe place where they won't be disturbed and let them sit overnight. Cover the oats with linen or something similar when leaving them overnight.

steps.headline: Combine your oatmeal and whiskey.
steps.description: After the oats have soaked up the water, pour 8 fluid ounces (240 mL) of whiskey into the bowl with the oats. Use a fairly shallow container.

steps.headline: Leave the mixture overnight.
steps.description: Cover your oats/whiskey mixture with linen or a similar material. Place the mixture somewhere safe. Let it sit overnight so the whiskey can soak up the flavor of the oats.

steps.headline: Drain the liquid from the oatmeal.
steps.description: Pour the whiskey mixture into a strainer or colander. Collect the liquid that drains in a bowl or similar container. To get as much whiskey as possible, press down gently on the oats to squeeze out excess whiskey.

steps.headline: Stir in cream, if desired.
steps.description: Pour 2 fluid ounces (59 mL) of cream into the strained whiskey. Use a spoon or wire whisk to beat everything together until it's evenly combined. You can omit the cream if you'd like.

steps.headline: Whisk in the honey.
steps.description: Once the cream is combined, add in 3 teaspoons (15 mL) of honey. Use a wire whisk to beat the honey into the whiskey/cream mixture.

steps.headline: Stir everything together until it's completely mixed.
steps.description: Continue whisking after adding the honey. You want everything to combine into a smooth mixture that's even throughout. This can take several minutes, so have patience.

parts.name: Storing and Serving Your Atholl Brose

steps.headline: Shake your atholl brose before serving.
steps.description: After you're done mixing the atholl brose, it can be transferred to a bottle. Each time you pour a glass, give the bottle a good shake. This helps mix the ingredients together in case they separated in storage.

steps.headline: Store your atholl brose in the fridge.
steps.description: As it contains cream, atholl brose should be stored in the fridge. This prevents spoilage and keeps the atholl brose safe to drink.

steps.headline: Discard your atholl brose after 1 week.
steps.description: Atholl brose unfortunately does not have a long shelf life. If you don't drink your atholl brose within a week, throw it away.
